newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's forint ends firmer vs dlr, basket.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's forint ends firmer vs dlr, basket.

text.p: The Hungarian forint closed a little firmer against the dollar and also firmer against the currency basket on Tuesday, dealers said.

The forint ended at 184.05/10 to the dollar, compared to 184.42/47 at the opening, and dealers said it reduced its gap from the central bank's resistance level to around five pips from 30 in the morning.

"Tension has relaxed on the market, people were selling currency," said Robert Szucs of Inter-Europa Bank. "Unless anything (unexpected) happens, I guess we'll move back to touch the bid by the end of the week."

Dealers said earlier this week the dollar buying, as a result of which the forint distanced itself from the central bank's resistance level, was speculative and Hungary's strong economic fundamentals did not justify the easing of the forint.
(The NBH intervention band is 4.5 percent wide. The forint floats against a currency basket made up 30 percent of the dollar and 70 percent of the mark.)
